summary: Time4jail expanded into a women’s-safety, anti-stalking incident documentation app with incident logging, evidence capture, reporting utilities (auto report numbers, summaries), messaging/SMS tools, police department lookup/saving, resources, PWA install guidance, and private-only customization.
architectural_notes: Add support for user-specific personalization of UI copy/tone (target persona: angry woman dealing with long-term stalking).
Plan secure storage/handling for evidence uploads (photos/audio/video) and associated metadata.
Implement SMS prefill via deep link / OS share intent for one-tap “Send via SMS”.
Define approach for police department lookup (Google integration) and a model for ‘personal’ vs ‘globally verified’ saved departments.
Add PWA install guidance and ensure app is PWA-capable (manifest/service worker) if not already.
User requests a black background + bright purple text color scheme (note: overrides prior preference to avoid blue/purple themes).
Ensure user-facing copy updates remain safety-focused and non-violent/non-harassing (avoid wording like "punish men"), while still supporting an empowered, zero-tolerance anti-stalking tone.
Refactor logged-in landing UI so Sign Out is rendered only once in a consistent top-right header location and never overlaps the primary CTA/hero content.
When increasing tone harshness around consequences (e.g., jail), keep copy safety-focused and framed around legal accountability/documentation; avoid threats, harassment, or calls for violence.

Do not store/display real-person mugshots or modified versions intended to shame/target; if adding a post-login image, use user-owned/consented imagery or symbolic/abstract graphics and keep it safety-focused.
known_issues: Logged-out landing page primary CTA (“Report him!”) is not accessible/clickable for the user (still blocked/overlapped or otherwise not interactive).
Home/Landing primary CTA is still blocked by a "You're protected" prompt/overlay, preventing the user from proceeding.
User cannot save Police Department entries (police department saving appears broken).

existing_features.title: Set the application title/branding text to "jailtime" everywhere it is shown to the user (e.g., browser tab title, top-level header/landing title, and any other prominent app-name labels).
Create a cohesive, distinct visual theme (color palette, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across the app UI. Do not use a blue+purple theme.
Change the application title/branding text to "Time4jail" everywhere it is shown to the user (browser tab title, document title, header branding).

Personalize the Home/Landing page user-facing copy and section headings for an angry woman who has been dealing with a man stalking her for 4 years, using an empowering, safety-focused tone (no harassment, threats, or violence), while keeping the existing authentication flow intact.

Add incident reporting UI: a guided, workflow-first incident form that captures detailed notes, incident date/time, and links/selects a stalker profile; support creating, editing, viewing, and deleting incidents and show an incident history log view with filtering/sorting by date.

Add stalker profiles UI: a tab/page to create, view, edit, and delete saved stalker profiles; include fields needed to associate incidents (e.g., name/alias and freeform identifying notes), and allow selecting a stalker profile from incident creation/edit flows.

Add evidence upload + evidence record functionality: allow uploading and storing evidence files (photos, screenshots, audio, video) with evidence metadata and linking evidence records to an incident; provide a dedicated “Evidence Record” tab/page that lists all evidence and supports preview/download where feasible.
Implement Criminal Activity Report Number auto-generation for incidents/reports and display it consistently on incident detail and any export/share surfaces in the app UI.

Add a message generator tool with selectable tone options (calm, firm, severe, very harsh) that produces an editable message; add a one-tap “Send via SMS” action that opens the device’s texting app with the generated message prefilled (using an sms: link).

Add an “Summarize All Incidents” feature that generates a structured summary across all incidents (timeline highlights, counts, and key recurring patterns) and allows copying/exporting the result from the UI.
Add a Victim/Survivor Info tab/page that stores optional personal details (user-controlled) with clear privacy language and the ability to leave fields blank; allow editing and saving to the backend.

Add police department lookup and saving: provide a “Search via Google” action (opens a new tab with a prefilled Google search query) plus manual entry/editing; implement saved police departments as (a) personal saved list per user and (b) a globally visible verified list (read-only for normal users).

Add a Crime Help / resources section with a clear external link list (opens in a new tab) and include an Install Guide page that provides PWA installation instructions for iOS (Safari), Android (Chrome), and desktop browsers.

Update the authenticated app navigation into a workflow-optimized tab order that includes at minimum: Incidents (new/report + history), Evidence Record, Stalker Profiles, Message Generator, Police Departments, Victim/Survivor Info, Resources, Install Guide; keep the existing authentication flow intact and ensure unauthenticated users remain on the current landing experience.

Add private-only customization capability: provide per-user settings to adjust app visuals and tone/language style, including a bold women’s-safety centered theme option and a full red, personal, angry feminine theme option; apply the selected theme consistently across the UI for that user.

Update the global default visual theme so the app renders with a black background and bright purple foreground text across all pages (authenticated and unauthenticated), using the existing CSS variable theming system.

Preserve existing non-default theme variants (e.g., womenSafety and redFeminineBold) so they continue to work, while making the updated black+bright-purple scheme the default styling when no special theme is selected.

Update the Home/Landing page hero headline and supporting copy to replace the current “Four Years of Hell. Time to Document It All.” phrasing with copy centered on “Document it all”, and add the slogan “Zero Tolerance for Stalking” as prominent user-facing text on the landing page.

In the Home/Landing page hero section, replace or rewrite the requested line “AI is taking the side of women to punish men for their behavior” into a safety-focused, non-violent, non-harassing statement that still conveys women-centered support and accountability (e.g., emphasizing documentation, evidence organization, and seeking legal/accountability pathways, without advocating punishment or harm).
Fix the Home/Landing page primary CTA so it is actually clickable/interactive when the user is not authenticated, and it reliably triggers the Internet Identity login flow.
Change the logged-out Home/Landing page primary CTA button label text from “Start Documenting” to exactly “Report him!” (including punctuation).

Fix the public HomePage (logged-out landing experience) so the primary CTA button (“Report him!”) is fully clickable and is not blocked/overlapped by any “Sign Out” UI element or other overlaying layout layers (including the sticky header).
Remove or refactor redundant “Sign Out” rendering on the HomePage so sign-out controls are presented in a single, consistent location and cannot interfere with the HomePage CTA interaction.

Update the authenticated header layout so the “Sign Out” button is consistently positioned at the top-right of the app header (sticky header area) across responsive breakpoints, and is not rendered anywhere within the Home/Landing hero/content area.

Rewrite the Home/Landing hero paragraph copy about “AI-powered tools” to a harsher, women-centered accountability tone that explicitly references legal consequences (e.g., reporting, prosecution, jail) while remaining safety-focused and avoiding harassment, threats, or calls for violence.

Add the user-uploaded image (5425a899ef3d6.image.jpg) to the frontend as a static asset and display it automatically immediately after a successful Internet Identity sign-in (i.e., when the user transitions into the authenticated app), before the user interacts with the main authenticated workflow tabs.

Ensure authenticated users are not stuck on the Home/Landing page without access to the incident reporting workflow: when a user is authenticated (non-anonymous Internet Identity), render the authenticated workflow UI (tabs) even if the caller user profile has not been created yet, and keep showing the existing ProfileSetupModal until the profile is successfully saved.

On the Home/Landing page, ensure the primary CTA is accessible and actionable in all states: when unauthenticated, the “Report him!” button must be present and clickable and must trigger the Internet Identity login flow; when authenticated but the Home/Landing page is still visible for any reason, replace the hidden CTA with a clear primary action (e.g., “Go to Incidents”) that navigates the user into the authenticated workflow (Incidents tab).

Add a minimal UI regression check for clickability of the Home/Landing primary CTA by ensuring no layout layer (including the sticky header) can overlap and intercept clicks on the CTA area on common viewport sizes (mobile and desktop).

Ensure the logged-out Home/Landing page primary CTA button labeled “Report him!” is always clickable and reliably triggers the Internet Identity login flow, including on common mobile and desktop viewport sizes where the sticky header could overlap the hero area.

Adjust layout/styling so the sticky header cannot physically overlap the Home/Landing hero/CTA area (e.g., by reserving vertical space for the sticky header or otherwise preventing content from rendering underneath it).

Add a minimal UI regression check that guards against future reintroductions of the click-interception bug on the Home/Landing page CTA (ensure no layout layer, including the sticky header, can overlap and intercept clicks on the CTA area).

Fix authenticated routing so that once a user has successfully signed in with Internet Identity (non-anonymous principal), the app renders the authenticated workflow UI (tabs) instead of leaving the user on the Home/Landing page showing the “You're Protected” section, even when the caller user profile has not been created yet.

Ensure there is always a clear, actionable primary way to proceed when authenticated: if the Home/Landing page is ever displayed while authenticated for any reason, replace the “You're Protected” block as the primary focus with a prominent primary action button labeled “Go to Incidents” that takes the user into the authenticated workflow (Incidents tab).

Add/extend a minimal regression check so the app detects and logs when an authenticated user is incorrectly shown the Home/Landing page instead of the authenticated workflow, to prevent reintroducing the “stuck behind 'You're Protected'” experience.

Add a “Summarize All” action to the Evidence Record tab that generates a single, structured summary report across all evidence items for the signed-in user, using only evidence metadata and user-entered text fields (title/description/type/timestamps/link-to-incident where available), and present it in a modal with copy + download actions.

Implement tone selection for the Evidence summary with at least: Plain, Formal, Urgent, and “Urgent (with a feminine touch)”, ensuring all generated text remains factual, non-accusatory, and police-appropriate (no insults, no speculation, no labeling a real person as a “threat”).

Create a reusable evidence-summary generator utility (similar to the incident summary utility) that produces deterministic, structured output from the evidence list and selected tone, and ensure it is used by the Evidence summary modal.

Fix the Police Departments workflow so an authenticated user can successfully save a new police department and see it appear in their “My Saved” list immediately after saving, and still see it after a page refresh/re-login.

Improve Police Department save error handling in the UI so failures are clearly visible to the user (not only logged to the console), including the reason when available (e.g., unauthorized, validation issue, backend trap).

Add a minimal regression check (developer-facing) that detects and logs if the Police Department save mutation succeeds but the new item does not show up in the “My Saved” list after query invalidation/refetch, to prevent silent reintroductions of the issue.

Add a new primary action button labeled exactly "Submit report" to the Police tab (frontend/src/pages/workflow/PoliceDepartmentsPage.tsx) that starts a guided flow for compiling a police-ready report from the signed-in user’s incidents and evidence.

In the "Submit report" flow, load the caller’s incidents and evidence using existing React Query hooks and generate a single combined, police-ready report text by reusing the existing deterministic generators: frontend/src/utils/incidentSummary.ts (generateIncidentSummary) and frontend/src/utils/generateEvidenceSummary.ts (generateEvidenceSummary).

In the "Submit report" flow, require the user to choose a target police department from their available lists (My Saved and/or Verified) before enabling final report actions, and include the selected department’s name (and address/phone/website when present) in the combined report header.

Provide user actions within the "Submit report" dialog to support practical submission outside the app: (1) Copy report text to clipboard, and (2) Download report as a .txt file, using the existing download utility (frontend/src/utils/download.ts).

Add submission-assist shortcuts tied to the selected police department within the "Submit report" dialog: show a "Call" link when a phone number is present (tel:), and show an "Open website" link when a website is present (opens in a new tab).

Update the post-login splash screen (frontend/src/components/auth/PostLoginSplash.tsx) to display a single randomized motivational/support message immediately above or below the existing post-login image (/assets/5425a899ef3d6.image.jpg). The message must be selected at random from a fixed, hardcoded list each time the splash is shown for a new session.

Define the fixed message list used by the post-login splash randomizer to include the user-requested examples as inspirations while ensuring messages remain safety-focused, non-harassing, and non-violent (legal/accountability framing is allowed; no threats or calls for harm). Include at least these exact messages in the list: "Send him to jail.", "No meant no.", "He will pay for what he did.", and "Don't stop until he is in cuffs."

Update the Message Generator templates to use a harsher, women-centered accountability tone toward the stalker while remaining safety-focused and non-violent/non-harassing, and without making actionable threats or encouraging harm.

Adjust the fixed post-login splash message pool to include additional harsher, accountability-focused motivational lines (still non-violent and non-harassing) while preserving the required exact existing messages already in the list.

Ensure any 'urgent' evidence summary copy remains police-appropriate and can be harsh/accountability-focused without inflammatory labeling; remove or rewrite any wording that characterizes the stalker as a "threat" while keeping urgency and safety emphasis.

new_feature_requests.summary: Change the application title/branding text to "Time4jail" everywhere it is shown (browser tab title, headers, landing title, etc.).
Personalize the app’s tone/content for an angry woman who has been dealing with a man stalking her for 4 years (copy/UX tailored to this context).
Add full incident reporting flow (detailed notes, timestamps, stalker info) with incident history log and optimized tab/workflow order.
Add evidence uploads/records (photos, screenshots, audio, video) including an Evidence Record tab.
Add stalker profiles (saved, editable) to link to incidents.
Auto-generate a Criminal Activity Report Number for incidents/reports.
Add a message generator with selectable tone (calm, firm, severe, very harsh) and one-tap “Send via SMS” to prefill the texting app.
Add incident summarizer feature (e.g., “Summarize All Incidents”).
Add optional victim/survivor info tab for personal details.
Add police department lookup (via Google) plus manual entry/editing; allow saving departments (personal and globally verified).
Add Crime Help/resources link section.
Add PWA Install Guide (installation instructions).
Update visual theme/branding: bold women’s-safety centered, full red ‘angry feminine’ private-version theme.
Support private-only customization capability (visuals, language, tone).

Implement backend data models and canister APIs to support authenticated, per-user storage for: incidents (with timestamps and detailed notes), stalker profiles (saved/editable), evidence records (metadata + uploaded file bytes), victim/survivor optional info, police departments (personal saved list), and user customization settings (visuals/language/tone).
Update app color scheme to black background with bright purple text (user-requested theme change).

Update landing/homepage hero copy: change phrase "four years of hell time to document it all" to "document it all" and add headings/slogans like "Zero Tolerance for Stalking"; ensure tone stays safety-focused and avoids language advocating punishment/harassment.
Fix the Home/Landing CTA so the “Start Documenting” button is clickable/available, and update its label text to “Report him!”
Move the Sign Out button to the top-right only (remove it from the hero/landing area) so it cannot overlap or block the primary CTA.

Rewrite/adjust the Home/Landing hero copy about AI taking on stalkers to a harsher, women-centered accountability tone that emphasizes documentation and legal consequences (e.g., jail/prosecution) while remaining safety-focused and non-violent/non-harassing.
Show a user-supplied image immediately after sign-in (post-login screen/splash) on Time4jail.

Add a “Summarize All Evidence” feature in the Evidence tab that summarizes extracted text from uploaded articles/documents/notes into a neutral, factual, police-appropriate report with selectable tones including an “Urgent (with a feminine touch)” option (empathetic framing + assertive urgency, non-accusatory).

Add a “Submit Report” button in the Police tab that compiles the user’s summarized incidents + summarized evidence into a police-ready report and initiates submission to the selected/saved police department.
Add randomized motivational/empowerment text lines displayed above/below the post-login image (shown immediately after sign-in).
Adjust overall app copy/tone to be harsher toward the stalker (women-centered accountability framing) while remaining safety-focused and non-violent/non-harassing.
